details.title: Phenomenology of Doppler forward scatter radar for surface targets observation

authors.affiliation: National Research University of Electronic Technology, Russia
authors.name: Vladimir Sizov

details.abstract: In this study, the forward scatter Doppler phase signature formation is analysed to show the rationale for the forward scatter radar in the true sense of the meaning, where a target actually crosses the baseline; so the advantage of the main shadow lobe is taken and, therefore a forward scatter effect occurs to enhance signal to clutter ratio. The modelling approach suggested is based on the consideration of the Doppler phase signature as a result of superposition of the direct path signal and the shadow radiation signal. It is shown that the target signature may be represented as a Doppler signature of a point-like target specified by its trajectory and speed, which is modulated according to forward scatter cross-section of an actual extended target specified by its silhouette at each moment of motion. The proposed model may be recommended to provide matched filtering in coherent processing. Finally, the approach is verified experimentally using calibrated targets with conductive and absorbing coating in the controlled environment and maritime targets in the real sea conditions.

ieee.title: Software defined radio for profile reconstruction in Forward Scatter Radar
ieee.displayText: Stanislav Hristov, Liam Daniel, Marina Gashinova, "Software defined radio for profile reconstruction in Forward Scatter Radar", European Radar Conference (EuRAD) 2014 11th, pp. 573-576, 2014.

ieee.title: Software defined radio for profile reconstruction in forward scatter radar
ieee.displayText: Stanislav Hristov, Liam Daniel, Marina Gashinova, "Software defined radio for profile reconstruction in forward scatter radar", Microwave Conference (EuMC) 2014 44th European, pp. 1876-1879, 2014.

ieee.title: Forward scatter radar modeling: Effects of near field for canonical targets
ieee.displayText: Marta Tecla Falconi, Davide Comite, Alessandro Galli, Pierfrancesco Lombardo, Frank Silvio Marzano, "Forward scatter radar modeling: Effects of near field for canonical targets", Antennas and Propagation & USNC/URSI National Radio Science Meeting 2015 IEEE International Symposium on, pp. 492-493, 2015.

ieee.title: Simultaneous data collection of small maritime targets using multistatic and forward scatter radar
ieee.displayText: Matthew Ritchie, Francesco Fioranelli, Karl Woodbridge, Hugh Griffiths, Liam Daniel, Alessandro De Luca, Stanislav Hristov, Marina Gashinova, Mikhail Cherniakov, "Simultaneous data collection of small maritime targets using multistatic and forward scatter radar", Radar Conference 2015 IEEE, pp. 203-208, 2015.

ieee.title: Maritime FSR with moving receiver for small target detection
ieee.displayText: A. De Luca, L. Daniel, K. Kabakchiev, E. Hoare, M. Gashinova, M. Cherniakov, "Maritime FSR with moving receiver for small target detection", Radar Symposium (IRS) 2015 16th International, pp. 834-839, 2015.

ieee.title: Target Shadow Profile Reconstruction in ground-based forward scatter radar
ieee.displayText: Stanislav Hristov, Liam Daniel, Edward Hoare, Mikhail Cherniakov, Marina Gashinova, "Target Shadow Profile Reconstruction in ground-based forward scatter radar", Radar Conference (RadarCon) 2015 IEEE, pp. 0846-0851, 2015.

ieee.title: Radar parameters influence on the clutter in maritime forward scatter radar

ieee.title: Target visibility estimation in a buoy mounted maritime forward scatter radar
ieee.displayText: L.Y. Daniel, M.S. Gashinova, M. Cherniakov, "Target visibility estimation in a buoy mounted maritime forward scatter radar", Radar Conference (RadarCon) 2015 IEEE, pp. 0755-0760, 2015.
